io.spine.validate.option

Class FieldValidatingOption<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.code.proto.AbstractOption<F,com.google.protobuf.Descriptors.FieldDescriptor,com.google.protobuf.DescriptorProtos.FieldOptions>
      • io.spine.code.proto.FieldOption<T>
        • io.spine.validate.option.FieldValidatingOption<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of value held by this option
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Option<T,com.google.protobuf.Descriptors.FieldDescriptor>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Distinct, Goes, Required, Valid

    @Immutable
public abstract class FieldValidatingOption<T>
extends FieldOption<T>
    An option that validates a field.

    Validating options impose constraint on fields that they are applied to.

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected FieldValidatingOption(com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessage.GeneratedExtension<com.google.protobuf.DescriptorProtos.FieldOptions,T> optionExtension)
      Specifies the extension that corresponds to this option.

    • Method Detail

      • optionValue

        protected T optionValue(FieldContext field)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns a value of the option.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        API Note:
        Should only be called by subclasses in circumstances that assume presence of the option. For all other cases please refer to valueFrom(FieldContext).

      • valueFrom

        public java.util.Optional<T> valueFrom(FieldContext context)
        Takes the value of the option from the given descriptor, given the specified context.

        The value is firstly obtained from the external constraint and if an external constraint is not present, the value is obtained from the actual field constraint.

        Parameters:
        context - context of the field
        Returns:
        an Optional with an option value if such exists, otherwise an empty Optional
        API Note:
        Use this in favour of optionsFrom(FieldDescriptor) when FieldContext matters, e.g. when handling (constraint_for) options.

      • shouldValidate

        public boolean shouldValidate(FieldContext context)
        Returns true if this option exists for the specified field, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        context - the value to be validated

      • constraintFor

        public Constraint constraintFor(C field)
        Creates a Constraint for the given field based on the value of the option.
